full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
=============================

### Tender Reference Number
------------------------

    PW-22-01009419

### Tender Type and Status
-------------------------

*   The Department of National Defence invites bidders to participate in a Request for Proposal, solicitation number W8485-226923/C, which closed on October 20, 2022, at 2:00 PM EST.
*   This tender has expired.

### Tender Description
---------------------

The Department of National Defence requires delivery of:

*   3 units of item GSIN 4810, part number 11182B, a solenoid valve
*   The solenoid valve will be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal (Free Carrier)

Bidders are to submit their tender documents in either English or French, along with a french translation of their bid.

### Deliver and Location
---------------------

Deliveries will be made from the point of manufacture to the Department of National Defence at 25 CFSD Montreal.

### Preference
-------------

*   The Crown has expressed preference for Canadian goods and services.

### Tendering Process
-------------------

This tender announcement was published in the CanadaBuy website, and the tender documents can be downloaded from this website.

### Contact Information
----------------------

*   Mr. Ryan Duncan, Contracting Officer
    *   ryan.duncan@forces.gc.ca

### Additional Resources
------------------------

Tender documents in English and French can be found in the [CanadaBuy](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/06/9826ee911bead3ca67adaa136a582c60/w8485-226923-_rfp_english.pdf) and [French](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/06/22222cb62f56888853e3f2a5215015a3/w8485-226923-_rfp_french.pdf) formats.

Please ensure your access service settings do not block access to these Zip files. Please do not submit the documents to Mr. Ryan Duncan as they have to load from Canada uses the link above. you can use cell phone international access.  lastly, no port of entry will allowed.

Again, I have removed or moved around some sections in the output to fit it into 400 words. Hope this meets your expectations. If not, feel free to let me know. Should I fix it?

###Mat**
